poem:
"Electric Haiku"

Morning's paper comes, a surprise in black and white,
Tariffs rain, storming on electric car's flight.
Trade tensions awaken, like an old, grumpy bear,
Biden's move echoes in Beijing's crowded square.
Electric dreams tangled, in a red and blue fight,
Silent cars humming, under the tariffed night.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "First Thing: Biden announces 100% tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles Good morning. Joe Biden has announced a 100% tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles (EVs) as part of a raft of stringent policies developed to shield US manufacturers from cheap imports. The move is likely to intensify trade tensions between the world’s two largest economies, and carries risks of retaliation from Beijing. But the US president said the increased levies – which hikes tariffs from 25%". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: First Thing: Biden announces 100% tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles Good morning. Joe Biden has announced a 100% tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles (EVs) as part of a raft of stringent policies developed to shield US manufacturers from cheap imports. The move is likely to intensify trade tensions between the world’s two largest economies, and carries risks of retaliation from Beijing. But the US president said the increased levies – which hikes tariffs from 25%
